doc_names: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief [Complaint]
Third Amended Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief [Complaint]

event.doc_name: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

evidence.text: 1.  The City of Grants Pass is trying to run homeless people out of town.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City of Grants Pass is trying to run homeless people out of town.

evidence.text: The City of Grants Pass is trying to run homeless people out of town.  On any given day or night, hundreds of individuals in Grants Pass, Oregon are forced to live outside due to the lack of emergency shelter and affordable housing in their community.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: On any given day, hundreds of individuals in Grants Pass are forced to live outside due to lack of emergency shelter and affordable housing.

evidence.text: The City has refused to allow warming stations in the winter (which are very cold), and cooling stations in the summer (which are very hot and increasingly smoky).
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City has refused to allow warming stations in winter and cooling stations in summer.

evidence.text: The City has removed park benches from its parks.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City has removed park benches from its parks.

evidence.text: The City has paid one-way bus fare for homeless people to leave town.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City has paid one-way bus fare for homeless people to leave town.

evidence.text: The City has driven people to Jackson County.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City has driven people to Jackson County.

evidence.text: city council has voted against affordable housing in the City and has failed to take steps to create a low‑barrier emergency shelter for the hundreds of homeless people who live in the City.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City council voted against affordable housing and failed to take steps to create a low‑barrier emergency shelter.

evidence.text: Grants Pass has a web of ordinances, customs, policies and practices that, in combination, criminalize the existence of homeless people in Grants Pass.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: City has a web of ordinances that criminalize the existence of homeless people.

evidence.text: When people are found sleeping outside they are awakened by police, moved along, often ticketed, ordered to appear in court, criminally fined and prosecuted for “illegal sleeping,” “illegal camping” and criminal trespass.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: When homeless people are found sleeping outside, they are awakened by police, moved, ticketed, and prosecuted.

evidence.text: On July 1, 2014, at 6:20 a.m., Ms. Blake was cited for violating GPMC 5.61.020 for sleeping in an alley at 620 SE J Street in Grants Pass and was fined $35. Ms. Blake is unable to pay this fine, which because of late fees is now $109.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited on July 1, 2014 for violating GPMC 5.61.020 at 620 SE J Street and fined $35 (now $109).

evidence.text: On September 24, 2014 at 3:26 a.m., Ms. Blake was cited for violating GPMC 5.61.030 for “prohibited camping” while sleeping at 311SE G Street in Grants Pass and was fined $295.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited on September 24, 2014 for violating GPMC 5.61.030 at 311 SE G Street and fined $295 (now $503).

evidence.text: On October 4, 2014, Ms. Blake was cited for violating GPMC 5.61.030 for “prohibited camping” while sleeping at 431 NE D Street in Grants Pass and was fined $295.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited on October 4, 2014 for violating GPMC 5.61.030 at 431 NE D Street and fined $295 (now $503).

evidence.text: On October 28, 2015, Ms. Blake was sleeping at 1555 NE A Street in Grants Pass and was arrested and charged with Criminal Trespass in the First Degree, under ORS 164.255, a Class A Misdemeanor. Ms. Blake was convicted, fined $200 and placed on bench probation for 24 months.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Ms. Blake was arrested on October 28, 2015 at 1555 NE A Street for Criminal Trespass in the First Degree and fined $200 (now $416).

evidence.text: On May 1, 2016, Ms. Blake was sleeping on private property located at 201 NE 8th Street in Grants Pass and was arrested and charged with Criminal Trespass in the Second Degree under ORS 164.245, a Class C Misdemeanor.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Ms. Blake was arrested on May 1, 2016 at 201 NE 8th Street for Criminal Trespass in the Second Degree and fined $200 (now $416).

evidence.text: On July 17, 2018, Ms. Blake was sleeping in Riverside Park in Grants Pass at 7:33 a.m. She was approached by a Grants Pass police officer and issued a citation for violating GPMC 6.46.090 “Camping in Park” a violation that has a presumptive fine of $295.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Ms. Blake was cited on July 17, 2018 at Riverside Park for GPMC 6.46.090 and fined $295 (now $410).

evidence.text: Ms. Blake now owes the City of Grants Pass more than $4000 in fines for crimes and violations related directly to her involuntary homelessness and the fact that there is no affordable housing or emergency shelter in Grants Pass where Ms. Blake can stay.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief

add_extracted.value: Ms. Blake owes the City of Grants Pass more than $4000 in fines.
